title: Russian Missile Unit Bombed Down Near Balaklava In Crimea
message:
Russian Missile Unit Bombed Down Near Balaklava In Crimea 3 2.07.2024, 7:3323,386Satellite images with the consequences of the strike have appeared.
And there was a Russian missile unit somewhere there.
However, at 21:04, the "Crimean Wind" telegram channel found out that the explosion and fire took place in a military unit near the village of Flotske (Karan) in Balaklava.
Later, the Crimean Wind monitoring group, based on the analysis of photos and videos, found out what landed in the Russian missile unit near the village of Flotske in Balaklava and released the relevant satellite images.
In addition, according to the subscribers of "Crimean Wind", windows and glass were blown out in private houses near the blown up Russian unit.
event_breakdown: Target event: Russian Missile Unit bombed down near Balaklava in Crimea on July 3, 2024, at 7:33 PM.

title: Palestinian group Islamic Jihad fires rockets into Israel , no casualties reported
message:
The Palestinian militant group Islamic Jihad fired a barrage of rockets into Israel on Monday as fighting raged in Gaza and Israeli tanks advanced deeper in parts of the enclave, residents and officials said.
advertisementThe volley of about 20 rockets caused no casualties, the Israeli military said.
The Israeli military said in a statement earlier on Monday the rockets were fired from the Khan Younis area.
The Israeli military announced the death of a soldier in southern Gaza without providing details.
Israeli authorities released 54 Palestinians it had detained during the war, Palestinian border officials said.
event_breakdown:
Here are the relevant events:
Gaza Strip
Gaza Strip's Hamas fired approximately 20 rockets into Israel on Monday as fighting raged in Gaza and Israeli tanks advanced deeper in parts of the enclave, residents and officials said. Israeli military announced the death of a soldier in southern Gaza without providing details.

title: Palestinian militants fire rockets into Israel , tanks advance in Gaza
message:
The volley of about 20 rockets caused no casualties, the Israeli military said.
The Israeli military said in a statement earlier on Monday the rockets were fired from the Khan Younis area.
Israeli tanks deepened incursions into the Shejaia suburb of eastern Gaza City for a fifth day, and tanks advanced further in western and central Rafah, in southern Gaza near the border with Egypt, residents said.
The Israeli military announced the death of a soldier in southern Gaza without providing details.
Israel says 317 of its soldiers have been killed in Gaza and that at least a third of the Palestinian dead are fighters.
event_breakdown: Israeli tanks invaded Gaza City and Rafah on Monday, continuing their push into Palestinian territory. The Israeli military released a statement saying that about 20 rockets were fired from the Khan Younis area, causing no casualties. In retaliation, Israeli tanks advanced into four neighborhoods in Gaza, including Shejaia in the east and Rafah in the south, where the army confirmed the death of one soldier.

title: IDF targets Hamas in Gaza operations , destroys terror infrastructure
message:
IDF continued operating in the areas of Shejaia, Rafah, and the central Gaza Strip, destroying terror infrastructure and searching for Hamas terrorists, the IDF reported on Tuesday morning.
According to the reports, IDF troops ambushed an armed terrorist squad advancing in a vehicle toward them in Rafah.
IDF uncovers weapons and gearDuring the raids, IDF troops located large amounts of combat equipment, including weapons and protective gear.
(credit: IDF SPOKESPERSON'S UNIT)In central Gaza, during close-quarters combat, IDF troops eliminated terrorists and located large amounts of military equipment, including weapons.
Throughout the operation, IAF reportedly struck around 30 terror targets, including weapon storage facilities, terrorist infrastructure, and Hamas terror military structures.
event_breakdown: IDF continues operating in Gaza, targets terror infrastructure and Hamas terrorists. IDF troops ambush armed terrorist squad, eliminate terrorists in central Gaza, strike 30 terror targets.

title: Hezbollah member killed in Israeli airstrike on Lebanese village
message:
Beirut, July 2 : A Hezbollah member was killed in an Israeli airstrike in the village of Aitaroun in southern Lebanon, said Lebanese military sources.
An Israeli warplane fired two air-to-surface missiles at a house in the center of Aitaroun, killing a Hezbollah member on Monday, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
The military sources added that Israel launched seven airstrikes on five towns and villages and fired 45 shells on ten border towns and villages in southern Lebanon during the day.
For its part, Hezbollah announced that it attacked several Israeli sites, including Al-Samaqa, Dovev, and Ramot Naftali.
Since the start of the confrontations with Israeli forces on the border, 357 members of the Lebanese armed group have been killed, according to Lebanese security and medical reports.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: A Hezbollah member was killed in an Israeli airstrike on Monday in Aitaroun, southern Lebanon. An Israeli warplane fired two air-to-surface missiles at a house in the center of the village.
Event 2: Israel launched seven airstrikes on five towns and villages and fired 45 shells on ten border towns and villages in southern Lebanon on Monday.
Event 3: Hezbollah announced that it attacked several Israeli sites, including Al-Samaqa, Dovev, and Ramot Naftali, on Monday or shortly thereafter.

title: Five Ukrainian fighter jets ruined in missile attack : Russia
message:
Moscow, July 2 : The Russian armed forces launched a missile strike on an airfield in Ukraine's Poltava region, destroying five Ukrainian Su-27 fighter jets, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday.
The attack by an Iskander-M operational-tactical missile system targeted the aircraft parking area at the Myrhorod airfield, the ministry said via its official social media channel.
It destroyed five Su-27 fighter jets belonging to the Ukrainian armed forces and damaged two more undergoing repairs at the time, reports Xinhua news agency.
The ministry also released video footage of the strike.
Ukrainian authorities have issued no immediate response.
event_breakdown: Russian Armed Forces launched missile strike on airfield in Poltava, Ukraine.

title: Russia attacks Myrhorod military airfield , official confirms  some losses
message:
Russian forces attacked the Myrhorod military airfield in Poltava Oblast, resulting in "some losses," former Air Force Spokesperson Yurii Ihnat confirmed on social media July 1.
Russian media sources previously circulated video footage of the strike and claimed to have damaged multiple Su-27 aircraft.
"The Air Force is doing everything to counteract the enemy, to mislead him, including with the help of models and other means," he said.
Ihnat was dismissed from his role as spokesperson on March 16, though he continues to work with the Air Force.
Russian forces previously carried out an intensive aerial attack against the Myrhorod military airfield in June 2023.
event_breakdown:
Russian forces attacked the Myrhorod military airfield in Poltava Oblast on July 1, resulting in "some losses," former Air Force Spokesperson Yurii Ihnat confirmed on social media. Russian media sources had circulated video footage of the strike and claimed to have damaged multiple Su-27 aircraft. However, Ihnat dismissed those claims and indicated that the Air Force had been using decoy means to confuse the Russians.

While targets like military airfields are not typically mapped on Google Maps, a point can be indicated at the general region of Poltava Oblast (further detailed to the region of Myrhorod) to visually represent the event. Myrhorod is about 285 miles (458 kilometers) northeast of Kyiv.

title: Thousands of Palestinians flee as Israel pounds Gaza
message:
The latest evacuation order has renewed fears among Palestinians, many of whom have been displaced multiple times by the Israel-Hamas war that started in October, with thousands fleeing.
The Israeli evacuation order sparked "fear and extreme anxiety", said Ahmad al-Najjar, a 26-year-old resident of Bani Suhaila.
- 'Maelstrom of misery' -Six consecutive days of intense battles followed a similar evacuation order issued last week for the Gaza City district of Shujaiya.
The Israeli military said its forces were operating in Shujaiya, central Gaza and Rafah, where air strikes and troops engaged in combat.
The Israeli army said it identified "approximately 15 projectiles... crossing from Lebanon, and 10 were successfully intercepted" without causing casualties.

Security event 1: The Israeli evacuation order sparked "fear and extreme anxiety", said Ahmad al-Najjar, a 26-year-old resident of Bani Suhaila.
Security event 2: The Israeli military said its forces were operating in Shujaiya, central Gaza and Rafah, where air strikes and troops engaged in combat.

title: Israel risking disastrous war against Hezbollah for political reasons , says former US official
message:
Israel risks going to war against Hezbollah to ensure Benjamin Netanyahu’s political survival, but it would be a miscalculation that could lead to mass civilian deaths in both Lebanon and Israel, a former US military intelligence analyst has warned.
He added that any Israeli government would be sensitive to political pressure from tens of thousands of Israelis displaced from the border area because of Hezbollah rocket and artillery attacks.
He argued Israel military was well aware it could not strike a decisive blow against Hezbollah’s fearsome armoury with pre-emptive strikes, as the rockets, missiles and artillery are dug into the mountainous Lebanese landscape.
Photograph: Menahem Kahana/AFP/Getty ImagesMann predicted Hezbollah would unleash a mass rocket and missile attack, if it felt it was under existential threat.
“Our least escalatory participation will be possibly striking supply lines or associated targets in Iraq and Syria to help cut off lines of communication and armaments flowing to Hezbollah,” Mann said.
event_breakdown:
Target event: War between Israel and Hezbollah
Event: Israel risks going to war against Hezbollah to ensure Benjamin Netanyahu’s political survival

Woman arrested in deadly shooting outside Phoenix club - A woman has been arrested in connection to a deadly shooting at a Phoenix club early Sunday morning. Authorities say 25-year-old Blanca Contreras is accused of shooting and killing a man outside the Club Sunset nightclub.

Suspect caught on camera stealing thousands of dollars' worth of belongings from man's car - Police have released video footage of a man stealing thousands of dollars' worth of personal belongings from a car in Phoenix. The suspect broke into the car while it was parked outside the victim's home and stole a laptop, camera equipment, and cash.

message:
Palestinians fled parts of southern Gaza in droves on Tuesday as Israeli forces launched deadly strikes and clashed with militants after issuing an evacuation order.
The latest evacuation order has renewed fears among Palestinians, many of whom have been displaced multiple times by the Israel-Hamas war that started in October, with thousands fleeing.
The Israeli evacuation order sparked "fear and extreme anxiety", said Ahmad al-Najjar, a 26-year-old resident of Bani Suhaila.
- 'Maelstrom of misery' -Six consecutive days of intense battles followed a similar evacuation order issued last week for the Gaza City district of Shujaiya.
The Israeli army said it identified "approximately 15 projectiles... crossing from Lebanon, and 10 were successfully intercepted" without causing casualties.

title: Russia Says Strikes Destroy Several Ukrainian Fighter Jets
message:
Russia’s Defense Ministry said Tuesday its missile strike on an airfield in central Ukraine has destroyed and damaged seven Ukrainian fighter jets.
“As a result of the Russian army’s strike, five active Su-27 multi-purpose fighters were destroyed and two under repair were damaged,” the military said on Telegram.
Undated aerial footage accompanying its short statement showed an explosion and smoke rising from an airfield.
Russia’s Defense Ministry said it had struck the Myrhorod airfield in Ukraine’s Poltava region.
event_breakdown: Russia's Defense Ministry said it destroyed seven Ukrainian fighter jets in an airstrike on the Myrhorod airfield in central Ukraine.

title: Investigation reveals adequate warnings before October 7 attack : Israeli chief of staff
message:
ALBAWABA- Israeli Channel 12 reported that the Chief of Staff received the preliminary results of the Intelligence Division’s investigation into the October 7 failure.
The investigation indicates that the warnings were sufficient to prevent the attack.

title: Ukraine Faces Electricity Cuts Due To Summer Demand , Effects Of Russian Strikes
message:
Ukraine Faces Electricity Cuts Due To Summer Demand, Effects Of Russian StrikesBy RFE/RL's Ukrainian Service and RFE/RL's Russian Service July 01, 2024Ukrainian electricity provider Ukrenerho warned of blackouts and other restrictions on July 1 because of the effects of Russia's ongoing campaign of attacks targeting energy infrastructure combined with increased demand due to high summer temperatures.
The company added that Poland, Slovakia, Romania, Hungary, and Moldova were providing electricity supplies to Ukraine.
Russia has been targeting Ukraine's electrical grid for months, forcing frequent power outages.
On June 23, Russia conducted its eighth large-scale strike targeting Ukraine's energy grid in the past three months.
The strikes damaged power transmission systems in the southeastern Zaporizhzhya and western Lviv regions, Ukrenerho said at the time.

Check out this wild confrontation -- a driver, accompanied by a woman, exits his white SUV, whips out a knife and charges at the driver of a silver SUV in the middle of the road, stabbing him several times in the arm on Saturday afternoon in Ontario.
A road rage rampage captured on camera ends in a violent stabbing on an Ontario street.
Various surveillance videos from local businesses show the silver SUV driver speeding into a parking lot, pulling up next to the white SUV, getting out, attempting to punch the other driver and then quickly fleeing.
The silver SUV driver later makes an illegal U-turn in the middle of the street, seemingly attempting to block the white SUV and ramming his car into it -- all this before the situation escalates into the stabbing.
event_breakdown:
Violent confrontation on Ontario street ends with stabbing on Saturday
On Saturday afternoon in Ontario, a road rage confrontation was captured by various surveillance cameras, which ended in a man getting stabbed in the arm with a knife multiple times.

title: Suspect arrested in fatal CTA shooting that wounded bus driver
message:
A CTA bus passenger was in police custody Tuesday in connection with a fight during a ride through the Douglas neighborhood that ended with another passenger shot to death, the bus driver wounded and the bus crashing into a tree.
The incident began about 12:15 a.m. Monday, when a 19-year-old man and several friends were riding on southbound bus in the 3400 block of South State Street.
The 19-year-old man, shot in the chest, was taken to the University of Chicago Medical Center where he was pronounced dead at 12:55 a.m., police said.
The bus driver, who did not return messages Tuesday, was taken to a hospital in good condition.
“No one should experience this kind of violence, especially while merely performing their duties serving the public as a bus driver,” Carter said.

title: Flames Spread From House To House After NW Oklahoma City Fire
message:
A house fire in northwestern Oklahoma City escalated after flames began to spread to another residence nearby, the Oklahoma City Fire Department said.
By: News 9-Firefighters battled heavy flames Monday night after a fire at a northwest Oklahoma City duplex.
According to residents in the area, children were shooting off fireworks in the street near the structure before flames broke out, however the Oklahoma City Fire Department cannot confirm that as the official cause.
The Oklahoma City Fire Department said the fire spread from one home to another one after starting in the garage of one home.
The Oklahoma City Fire Department is continuing to investigate the cause of the fire.

title: Iran vows to back Hezbollah in fight with Israel as IRGC general renews threat of imminent missile strike
message:
Iran vowed on Tuesday to back the terrorist organization Hezbollah “by all means” against Israel if Jerusalem launches an offensive in neighboring Lebanon.
“All Lebanese people, Arab countries and members of the Axis of Resistance will support Lebanon against Israel,” he said in an interview with the Financial Times.
The strike marked the first time Iran directly attacked Israel despite years of proxy fighting and apparent covert hits on top military targets.
Tehran’s involvement in Jerusalem’s fight in the Gaza Strip has increasingly drawn international concern.
As Hamas fights Israel, Hezbollah is drawing resources from the south toward the north, while proxies in Yemen and Iraq are trying to synchronize their fire against the Jewish state,” he warned.

Event: Iranian involvement in Jerusalem's fight with Hamas.

title: Italy seizes Chinese military drones heading to Libya , authorities say
message:
ROME — Italy has seized Chinese military drones disguised as wind turbines that were heading to Libya in violation of a U.N. embargo, Italian authorities said.
The drones were heading for Benghazi under orders from Gen. Khalifa Hifter, the military strongman controlling eastern Libya, sources told Defense News on the condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to speak to the press.
The description matches reports by sources that the drones were Chinese Wing Loong II unmanned aerial vehicles.
Italian tax police and customs officials seize what they described as Chinese drone components at the Port of Gioia Tauro in southern Italy in July 2024.
The seizure at the southern Italian port followed a Canadian police operation in April, which led to charges for two Libyan men living in Canada with conspiracy to buy Chinese drones with Libyan crude oil.

title: Counter - Terror Police Takes Charge Of Investigation Over Sydney University Stabbing
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Sydney, July 2 (IANS) A counter-terrorism force has engaged in the investigation after a teenager stabbed a 22-year-old student at the University of Sydney on Tuesday morning.
The wounded student, identified as an Australian national, was rushed to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital in a serious but stable condition.
Police confirmed the identity of the alleged assailant as a 14-year-old local who lives in Sydney's inner west.
The University of Sydney is located less than 3 km southwest of the city's central business district.
Vice-Chancellor and President of the University of Sydney Mark Scott expressed his feeling of being "deeply shocked and saddened" while assuring the community that there is no ongoing threat.

Alleged assailant: 14-year-old local
Recovery: Royal Prince Alfred Hospital

title: Nebraska Man Shoots 4 Kids , 3 Adults During Neighbor Party
message:
A Nebraska man shot seven people in what may have been a racially-motivated attack.
The Nebraska State Patrol said that 74-year-old Billy Booth opened fire on his neighbors with a shotgun while they were having a party at their home in Crete on Friday (June 28) afternoon.
There were about 15 people in the family's yard when Booth allegedly started shooting at them from inside his home.
Officials said that Booth did not get along with his neighbors and filed several police reports.
His neighbors, who are immigrants from Guatemala, filed one police report as well following an altercation with Booth.

title: Defence Ministry signs MoU to set up three testing facilities in Tamil Nadu
message:
The Ministry of Defence (MoD) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding to establish three state-of-the-art testing facilities in Chennai under the Tamil Nadu Defence Industrial Corridor - one each in Unmanned Aerial System (UAS), Electronic Warfare (EW) and Electro Optics (EO) domains.
The MoU, under the Defence Testing Infrastructure Scheme (DTIS), was signed by the MoD and Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation (TNIDC) Limited on Tuesday.
To provide impetus to the defence and aerospace sectors within the Defence Industrial Corridors, seven testing facilities were approved - four in Tamil Nadu and three in Uttar Pradesh.
For the UAS testing facility, Keltron, a Kerala government undertaking, is the lead SPV member, with some private sector companies being the consortium members.
Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) and India Optel Limited (IOL) are the lead SPV members in the EW and EO testing facilities respectively.

Two weeks after Zelenskyy’s comments, a senior U.S. official defense official said the policy may just be moving in that direction.
“You could just look at the maps ... showing the Russians amassing just across the border and using that to strike into Ukraine,” the U.S. defense official said.
Russia used glide bombs to attack the Epicenter shopping complex in Kharkiv, Ukraine, in May 2024, killing at least 19 people, including two children.
Under the current policy Russian forces will have to spread farther apart, lest they become easy targets.
“We don’t have enough capacity” to build the required amount of long-range weapons alone, he said.

title: MoD inks MoU to set up 3 testing facilities in Tamil Nadu Defence Corridor
message:
The Ministry of Defence has signed an MoU to establish three state-of-the-art testing facilities in Chennai under the Tamil Nadu Defence Industrial Corridor- one each in Unmanned Aerial System (UAS), Electronic Warfare (EW) and Electro-Optics (EO) domains.
The MoU, under the Defence Testing Infrastructure Scheme (DTIS), was exchanged between senior officials of MoD and Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation Limited in the presence of Defence Secretary Giridhar Aramane in the national capital.
To provide impetus to the defence and aerospace sectors within the Defence Industrial Corridors, seven testing facilities were approved - four in Tamil Nadu and three in Uttar Pradesh.
The MoU for three facilities in Tamil Nadu has been signed today.
Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) and India Optel Limited (IOL) are the lead SPV members in the EW and EO testing facilities respectively.
event_breakdown:
Target Event: MoU signed for state of the art testing facilities in Chennai, India
The Ministry of Defence has signed an MoU to establish three state-of-the-art testing facilities in Chennai, India under the Tamil Nadu Defence Industrial Corridor.

Saab has sold “thousands” of its Sirius Compact passive electronic warfare (EW) sensor systems in past the two years since the product was released but only in three versions of the four systems.

The L21R is similar but weighs 5.8kg and has a height of 48cm and diameter of 17cm covering 1-18GHz.

title: IDF Destroys Largest Islamic Jihad Rocket Manufacturing Site Found To Date
message:
The IDF announced that its troops located and demolished the largest Palestinian Islamic Jihad rocket manufacturing site found to date in southern Gaza’s Rafah.
The site, located in the Tel Sultan neighborhood, was raided by troops from the Commando Brigade, 401st Armored Brigade, and the elite Yahalom combat engineering unit.
According to the IDF, the underground facility was used by Islamic Jihad to manufacture rocket parts and long-range rockets, producing hundreds of projectiles in recent years.
The site was identified as the terrorist organization’s largest rocket manufacturing hub in the Gaza Strip.
The military utilized drones and guided missiles to neutralize several Islamic Jihad operatives, ensuring the successful destruction of the site.

title: 11th Airborne gets first new commander since Army Arctic command created 2 years ago
message:
Maj. Gen. Brian Eifler, outgoing commander of 11th Airborne Division and the division’s new commander, Maj. Gen. Joseph Hilbert, at the change of command at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson, Alaska, on June 27, 2024.
Army)The Army’s 11th Airborne Division, revived two years ago to serve as combat-ready unit for potential conflict near the Arctic Circle, changed command on June 27 for the first time.
Maj. Gen. Joseph Hilbert assumed command from Maj. Gen. Brian S. Eifler at the division headquarters at Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson in Alaska.
Eifler has been 11th Airborne Division commander since the Pentagon reestablished the division in 2022.
The 11th Airborne Division includes two brigade combat teams.

title: Marcos vows full support to Philippine Air Force
message:
PRESIDENT Ferdinand Marcos Jr. assured on Monday, July 1, 2024, his administration's continued support to the country's armed forces to transform its operational readiness and enhance its operational reach.
Marcos made the remarks as he attended the 77th founding anniversary of the Philippine Air Force (PAF) in Mabalacat, Pampanga.
“Indeed, these assets contribute to an agile Air Force -- capable of protecting our nation, our people, and our resources; and dedicated to ensuring that we are ready to face challenges with advanced precision, speed, and force,” said Marcos.
Marcos said the government has also taken significant steps that complement and boost the administration’s vision for a stronger and more capable Air Force through increased maritime domain awareness within the Philippine Air Force Defense Identification Zone.
“We are committed to providing the necessary legislative support to ensure that the modernization programs and welfare initiatives for our armed forces are fully funded and effectively implemented,” Romualdez said.
event_breakdown:
Target Event:
The Philippine Air Force (PAF) celebrated its 77th anniversary on July 1, 2024, in Mabalacat, Pampanga. The Founding Anniversary theme is "Dangalang Hanga, Kabalikat sa Kapayapaan," or better translated as "Pride in Service, Key to Peace." President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. attended.

title: Four killed in Israeli strike on camp in West Bank
message:
The Palestinian Authority's health ministry said an Israeli strike killed four Palestinians in the Nur Shams camp in the occupied West Bank.
The Ramallah-based health ministry said four people had been "killed as a result of the occupation's bombing of Nur Shams camp" near the northern West Bank town of Tulkarm.
Violence in the West Bank, already elevated before the 7 October attack by Hamas that ignited Israel's offensive in Gaza, has spiked since then.
At least 556 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli soldiers and settlers in the West Bank since the conflict in Gaza began, according to a health ministry tally.
In the West Bank, at least 15 Israelis have been killed in Palestinian attacks over the same period, according to an AFP tally based on official Israeli figures.

title: Italian Air Force 156th Squadron Reactivated At Luke AFB
message:
The 156° Gruppo (Squadron) at Luke AFB, Arizona, will be the F-35 OCU (Operational Conversion Unit) of the Italian Air Force.
The Italian Air Force has been present at the American base for some time, supporting pilot training activities with a contingent of seven F-35As deployed in Arizona under the command of RAMI (Rappresentanza Aeronautica Militare Italiana – Italian Air Force Mission) Eglin.
History of the 156th SquadronThe 156th Squadron was established on Jan. 20, 1941, at Comiso airport, in Sicily.
Following the Cuban Missile Crisis, the 156th Squadron was the first Italian unit to achieve “Strike” capability for the use of nuclear weapons.
Shortly before the transfer, the 156th Squadron abandoned its nuclear capability, returning to its initial role of conventional bombing.

title: How Many Ships Are in a Carrier Strike Group Or CSG And What Are They ?
message:
How Many Ships Are In A Carrier Strike Group?
Most people know that the United States has several aircraft carriers, but what isn't as well known is how they operate.
When a carrier deploys, it does so as the lead vessel in what's called a Carrier Strike Group (CSG) or Carrier Battle Group (CVBG).
A Carrier Strike Group typically consists of various types of cruisers, anti-aircraft surface vessels, anti-submarine destroyers, and frigates.
As of mid-2024, the U.S. Navy operates 11 carriers, and they each have a strike group associated with them.

title: Jury finds suspect not guilty in 2022 shooting at home in Peru , NE
message:
(WOWT) - A Nebraska shooting suspect was convicted of one charge but found “not guilty” of several others in court Tuesday.
A jury found Guadalupe DeLaCruz, 60, not guilty of 11 separate charges — including first-degree assault and child abuse — filed against him in relation to a 2022 shooting incident in Peru, Neb.
DeLaCruz was found guilty of one count carrying a concealed weapon.
Both he and his fiancé, Katelan Jacobs, were arrested in connection to that incident.

title: Israeli Drone Strike Kills Four in Nur Shams Camp
message:
Israeli forces assassinated four Palestinians, before midnight on Tuesday/Wednesday, when an armed drone fired a missile in the center of the Nur Shams refugee camp, east of Tulkarem in the northwestern part of the West Bank.
According to medical sources at the Martyr Thabet Thabet Governmental Hospital in Tulkarem, four Palestinian young men were killed by an Israeli drone strike in the center of the Nur Shams camp.
An Israeli drone strike killed a Palestinian woman, on Monday, and injured four others, while a soldier shot a 15-year-old child in the head with live ammunition, at the entrance to the Tulkarem refugee camp.
Military bulldozers caused severe destruction to vital infrastructure, including the main water line in the Nur Shams camp, in addition to citizens’ property, and also sabotaged several streets in various areas of Tulkarem city.
On Sunday, Israeli forces executed the young man, Saeed Izzat Jaber, 24, and injured five others, two seriously, after an armed Israeli drone fired three missiles at a citizen’s home in the Nur Shams camp.

title: Hizbollah says launched rocket salvo at north Israel after civilian death
message:
Israel and Hizbollah, an ally of Hamas, have traded near-daily cross-border fire since the Palestinian fighter group's October 7 attack on Israel sparked war in the Gaza Strip.
Hizbollah fighters launched "dozens of Katyusha rockets" at army barracks in northern Israel "in response to the Israeli enemy's attacks... and the killing of a civilian", the Lebanese group said in a statement.
Earlier Tuesday, Lebanese state media, an official and a minister said an Israeli strike killed a civilian in the country’s south.
“The strike that targeted Bustan killed a civilian,” said Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency, after earlier reporting Israeli warplanes had struck the village.
Bustan Mayor Adnan Ahmed told AFP the strike killed Muhieddin Abu Dallah, a farmer in his 50s, and damaged his house and agricultural machinery.
event_breakdown: Israeli strike on Bustan kills a civilian in Lebanon, reported the government-run news agency. The attack follows a series of rocket attacks carried out in southern Lebanon by Hizbollah "in response to the Israeli enemy's attacks".

title: USS MASON RETURNS TO MAYPORT FROM COMBAT DEPLOYMENT
message:
USS MASON RETURNS TO MAYPORT FROM COMBAT DEPLOYMENTUS Navy02 July 2024From ENS Emily MooreNAVAL STATION MAYPORT, Fla. -- Arleigh Burke-class guided-missile destroyer USS Mason (DDG 87) returned to Naval Station Mayport, July 2, 2024, after being deployed for more than eight months in the U.S.
While deployed, Mason faced unprecedented attacks from the Houthi terrorist group based out of Yemen.
While deployed, Mason intercepted multiple unmanned aerial vessels and anti-ship ballistic missiles targeting merchant vessels and coalition warships.
On Nov. 26, 2023, Mason responded to a distress call in the Gulf of Aden where five suspected pirates overtook M/V Central Park.
Once Mason arrived, the suspected pirates fled, and Mason's Visit, Board, Search, and Seizure team took custody of the suspected pirates and freed the crew stuck in the ship's citadel.
event_breakdown:
US NAVY AEGIS DESTROYER USS MASON RETURNS TO NAVAL STATION MAYPORT FROM COMBAT DEPLOYMENT - USS MASON DELIVERS SUSPECTED PIRATES TO DJIBOUTI JAIL
DJIBOUTI, Djibouti (NNS) -- Arleigh Burke-class guided-missile destroyer USS Mason (DDG 87) interdicted a skiff carrying suspected pirates off the coast of Somalia, May 15, 2024 and delivered a skiff with suspected pirates in custody to the port near Djibouti City, May 17.
The USS Mason was deployed in support of Combined Task Force (CTF) 151, a multinational task force established to conduct counter-terrorism operations to deny violent extremist organizations, including pirates, the opportunity to disrupt the lives of maritime and innocent citizens.

Day 859: As the Russia-Ukraine war continues, several Ukrainian cities came under bombardment by Russian forces in the past 24 hours. The city of Izyum was the target of the most intense shelling, while Donetsk and Luhansk regions in the southeast also experienced significant attacks. The Biden administration has faced pressure from Congress to send more powerful weapons to Ukraine as the war continues to rage.

The region has seen intense fighting in recent weeks as Russian seeks to take control of key industrial areas. Russia also conducted aerial strikes near Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city, which is located only 40 kilometers away from Russian-occupied territory.
Putin urges the West to lift sanctions
Russian President Vladimir Putin urged the West on Saturday to lift sanctions against Russia, saying the measures would only hurt the economies of western countries. In an interview with state TV, Putin also said the war in Ukraine was being fought to protect the Russian speaking population in the south and east against the tyranny of the Ukrainian government. Ukraine has denied this and described Putin's claims as Russian propaganda.

title: Somalia : Shabaab Strikes Djiboutian and Somali Troops in Central Somalia As Atmis Forces Withdraw
message:
The al-Qaeda-affiliated group Shabaab has claimed responsibility for a suicide car bombing targeting Djiboutian and Somali troops at a military base in central Somalia.
The blast marks the 14th such suicide bombing conducted by the insurgent group so far this year, underscoring the persistent threat it poses as African Union forces withdraw from the country.
The suicide bombing hit the Beledweyne headquarters of Djiboutian troops attached to the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS) in the Hiraan region.
The timing of the attack is particularly significant, as it comes amid the gradual withdrawal of ATMIS forces from Somalia.
According to data compiled by FDD's Long War Journal, the latest blast marks at least the 14th suicide bombing carried out by Shabaab this year.

title: Houthi explosive drone boat attacks escalate Red Sea danger
message:
By Jonathan Saul and Renee MaltezouLONDON (Reuters) - Yemen's Houthis are sending drone boats packed with explosives into the Red Sea as they intensify their attacks on merchant ships that have little defence against the "sophisticated shift" in tactic, maritime security sources say.
Iran-aligned Houthi militants first launched aerial drone and missile strikes on the trade route in November in what they say is solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.
In over 70 attacks, they have sunk two vessels, seized another and killed at least three seafarers.
According to maritime security sources and Reuters analysis, there have been at least six defensive strikes on USVs by US-led coalition warships since February.
On June 27 and June 30, two separate vessels were targeted by Houthi swarming tactics, including multiple seaborne attack drones, maritime agency, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO), said.
